title: Memoirs, journal, and correspondence of Thomas Moore.
author: Moore, Thomas
snippet: 19th. Awake at a little after four ; got up at half-past five, and was in Abbey Street at half-past six. The priest not yet come ; at seven he arrived, and we had mass in the room with the coffin.

title: Memoirs, journal, and correspondence of Thomas Moore.
author: Moore, Thomas
snippet: Took my time at breakfast, and waited for Ellen's note, but none came. Walked down to Abbey Street, and found that all was over ; my dear father had died at seven in the morning. Consulted about the funeral, which it was the wish of all to have as simple and private as possible : entrusted the management of it to Mr. Legh, the son of an old friend of my mother.
